references.paper_title: A closer look at memorization in deep networks
references.reason: This paper provides foundational knowledge on memorization in deep networks, which is relevant to understanding the challenges of out-of-distribution generalization in semantic segmentation.

references.paper_title: SegmentMeIfYouCan: A benchmark for anomaly segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces a benchmark dataset for anomaly segmentation, which is directly relevant to the focus of the target paper on semantic segmentation under multiple distribution shifts.

references.paper_title: Encoder-decoder with atrous separable convolution for semantic image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces a widely-used architecture (DeepLabv3+) for semantic segmentation, which serves as a baseline model for evaluating the performance of the target paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Masked-attention mask transformer for universal image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces another widely used architecture (Mask2Former) for semantic segmentation, which is also used as a baseline in the target paper for performance comparison.

references.paper_title: The cityscapes dataset for semantic urban scene understanding
references.reason: This paper introduces the Cityscapes dataset, which is used as the primary training dataset for the models evaluated in the target paper, thereby establishing a direct link to the methodology and results.
